text:
Hi everyone :wave:
I’m a 2nd year PhD student and I decided that the moment has come for me to learn Julia :smile:
What are the best resources you would suggest to get into the field (not too basic however, I’ve been programming –scientific programming, and mostly Python– for years now)?
I found the course _Introduction to Computational Thinking_ by MIT which uses Julia and looks great, do you suggest it? <https://computationalthinking.mit.edu/Spring21/>
Have any other valuable resource?

Thanks, and have a great week! :party_parrot:

text: Considering it is taught by one of Juila's founders, yes we suggest it. Also see <https://juliaacademy.com/>
